soloPlayDeath_ToFadeOutTime.Wiki: How many seconds have passed after YOU DIED is displayed at the time of death of solo play to start fading out?

partyGhostDeath_ToFadeOutTime.Wiki: How many seconds have passed after YOU DIED is displayed when a white or black ghost dies to start fading out?

playerMaxHpLimit.Wiki: It is used to calculate what percentage of the gauge length provided by the resource is used when displaying the HP gauge.

playerMaxMpLimit.Wiki: It is used to calculate what percentage of the gauge length provided by the resource is used when displaying the MP gauge.

playerMaxSpLimit.Wiki: It is used to calculate what percentage of the gauge length provided by the resource is used when displaying the SP gauge.

actionPanelChangeThreshold_Vel.Wiki: Action panel Switchable player speed. Switchable if below this speed

actionPanelChangeThreshold_PassTime.AltName: Action Panel Change Threshold - Pass Time
actionPanelChangeThreshold_PassTime.Wiki: Action panel Consideration time to increase the speed of switchable players. Use the average speed of this time (systematically up to 4 seconds)

kgIconVspace.AltName: Vertical Position of Key Guide Icon
kgIconVspace.Wiki: Vertical position of key guide icon (+ - top,- - bottom)

worldMapCursorSelectRadius.Wiki: If the cursor position is within this radius, it means that it is selected.

decalPosOffsetX.Wiki: Decal display position offset left and right

decalPosOffsetY.Wiki: Decal display position offset vertical direction

targetStateSearchDurationTime.Wiki: The number of seconds it takes for the FE Search icon to start fading in and then fading out.

targetStateBattleDurationTime.Wiki: The number of seconds it takes for the FE Battle icon to start fading in and then fading out.

worldMapCursorFirstDistance.Wiki: Distance to move only once at the first input [px]

worldMapCursorFirstDelay.Wiki: The time it takes to move only once at the first input [sec]

worldMapCursorWaitTime.Wiki: Waiting time from input to smooth movement [sec]

worldMapCursorSnapRadius.Wiki: Move the cursor closer than this radius to start adsorption (for snap mode) [px]

worldMapCursorSnapTime.Wiki: The time it takes to start and complete adsorption [sec]

itemGetLogAliveTime.Wiki: Time to add one line of log and fade out. There is a timer for each line [sec]

playerMaxSaLimit.Wiki: It is used to calculate what percentage of the gauge length provided by the resource is used when displaying the SA gauge.

worldMap_IsChangeableLayerEventFlagId.AltName: World Map - Underground Layer Event Flag ID
worldMap_IsChangeableLayerEventFlagId.Wiki: Specify the event flag ID that manages whether it is possible to switch to the underground map. When this event flag ID is ON, it is possible to switch to the underground map.

worldMap_TravelMargin.Wiki: Distance (m) that extends in four directions around the player. I decided to break through this range

systemAnnounceScrollBufferTime.Wiki: The number of seconds to wait before and after scrolling through the long text of the operation announcement. For example, if it is 3 seconds, wait for a total of 6 seconds before and after.

systemAnnounceScrollSpeed.Wiki: Scrolling speed (pixels / second) when scrolling long sentences in the operation announcement. It does not depend on the screen size. Think of the entire menu as 1920x1080

systemAnnounceNoScrollWaitTime.AltName: System Announcement - No Scroll Wait Time
systemAnnounceNoScrollWaitTime.Wiki: The number of seconds to display when it is a short sentence that does not require scrolling of the operation announcement

systemAnnounceScrollCount.Wiki: Number of times to repeat when scrolling long sentences of management announcement

compassMemoDispDistance.Wiki: Display distance [m] of the memo marker displayed on the compass. Anything closer than this distance will be displayed

compassBonfireDispDistance.Wiki: The display distance of the bonfire displayed on the compass [m]. Anything closer than this distance will be displayed

markerGoalThreshold.Wiki: Goal judgment distance [m] of the destination marker. The destination marker disappears when you get closer than this distance

svSliderStep.Wiki: Amount of movement of the saturation / brightness slider of the color control [% / sec]. Maximum amount to move in 1 second when each value is 0% to 100%. Since it is operated with an analog stick, it becomes a ratio by the input value.

preOpeningMovie_WaitSec.Wiki: Wait time before playing the OP movie. > SEQ 15261

kgIconScale.Wiki: The scale value of the key guide icon. 100% is the texture size as it is

kgIconScale_forTable.AltName: Key Guide Icon for Table - Scale
kgIconScale_forTable.Wiki: Scale value of the key guide icon for the pad operation list. 100% is the texture size as it is

kgIconVspace_forTable.AltName: Key Guide Icon for Table - Vertical Position
kgIconVspace_forTable.Wiki: Vertical position of the key guide icon for the pad operation list (+ - top,- - bottom)

kgIconScale_forConfig.AltName: Key Guide Icon for Key Config - Scale
kgIconScale_forConfig.Wiki: The scale value of the key guide icon for the key config. 100% is the texture size as it is

kgIconVspace_forConfig.AltName: Key Guide Icon for Key Config - Vertical Position
kgIconVspace_forConfig.Wiki: Vertical position of key guide icon for key config (+ - top,- - bottom)

worldMap_SearchRadius.Wiki: Range [m] (radius) that makes unsearched masks searched. It is assumed that the circle centered on the player has been searched.

tutorialDisplayTime.Wiki: Tutorial (toast notification) display time [sec]. It will be closed automatically after this time has passed

compassFriendHostInnerDistance.Wiki: Display distance [m] of other players (friendly hosts) to be displayed on the compass. If you are more than this distance, it will be displayed on the compass.

compassEnemyHostInnerDistance.Wiki: Display distance [m] of other players (enemy hosts) displayed on the compass. If you are more than this distance, it will be displayed on the compass.

compassFriendGuestInnerDistance.Wiki: Display distance [m] of other players (friendly guests) to be displayed on the compass. If you are more than this distance, it will be displayed on the compass.

cutsceneKeyGuideAliveTime.Wiki: The amount of time that the key guide will continue to be displayed after the cutscene skip has been pre-entered. Since skip input is accepted only while the key guide is displayed, it can be said that it is the skip input acceptance time.

autoHideHpThresholdRatio.AltName: Auto HUD - HP Ratio to display HUD
autoHideHpThresholdRatio.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] HP ratio. If the HP ratio is below this value, the HP gauge will always be displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

autoHideHpThresholdValue.AltName: Auto HUD - Display HUD when below X HP
autoHideHpThresholdValue.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] HP current value. If the current HP value is less than or equal to this value, the HP gauge will always be displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

autoHideMpThresholdRatio.AltName: Auto HUD - FP Ratio to display HUD
autoHideMpThresholdRatio.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] MP ratio. If the MP ratio is below this value, the MP gauge is always displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

autoHideMpThresholdValue.AltName: Auto HUD - Display HUD when below X FP
autoHideMpThresholdValue.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] MP current value. If the current MP value is less than or equal to this value, the MP gauge is always displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

autoHideSpThresholdRatio.AltName: Auto HUD - Stamina Ratio to display HUD
autoHideSpThresholdRatio.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] SP ratio. If the SP ratio is less than or equal to this value, the SP gauge is always displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

autoHideSpThresholdValue.AltName: Auto HUD - Display HUD when below X Stamina
autoHideSpThresholdValue.Wiki: [HUD - Auto setting] SP current value. If the current SP value is less than or equal to this value, the SP gauge is always displayed. Percentage and current value are OR conditions (displayed if either is satisfied)

worldMapZoomAnimationTime.Wiki: World map - Time to zoom animation [seconds]

worldMapIconScaleMin.Wiki: World map - Display magnification of the map point icon at zoom step 0 (0.0 to 1.0). 1x (1.0) at zoom step 2. From there, the icon magnification is also interpolated according to the enlargement ratio.

worldMap_TravelMargin_Point.Wiki: World map - Additional ban distance [m] when the ban is lifted in map point units. When the ban on map points such as the distant view stand is lifted, the ban on the traversal range will be lifted. Distance to be additionally extended in 4 directions around the map point

enemyTagSafeLeft.AltName: Enemy HP Guage - Max Left Justification
enemyTagSafeLeft.Wiki: How far can the center coordinates of the enemy HP gauge go to the left end? Since it is the center coordinate, the size of the gauge body is included.

enemyTagSafeRight.AltName: Enemy HP Guage - Max Right Justification
enemyTagSafeRight.Wiki: How far can the center coordinates of the enemy HP gauge go to the right end? Since it is the center coordinate, the size of the gauge body is included.

enemyTagSafeTop.AltName: Enemy HP Guage - Max Top Justification
enemyTagSafeTop.Wiki: How far can the center coordinates of the enemy HP gauge go to the upper end? Since it is the center coordinate, the size of the gauge body is included.

enemyTagSafeBottom.AltName: Enemy HP Guage - Max Bottom Justification
enemyTagSafeBottom.Wiki: How far can the center coordinates of the enemy HP gauge go to the lower end? Since it is the center coordinate, the size of the gauge body is included.

pcHorseHpRecoverDispThreshold.AltName: HP Threshold to display Horse HP
pcHorseHpRecoverDispThreshold.Wiki: Threshold for displaying the PC horse HP gauge at the time of recovery. Constant value of Display HP bar when it increases more than a certain value at a time
